speaker: Skyline
text: Radio waves emanante from the top of the Space Needle._       [_Scene 1 - KACL.  Frasier is finishing a segment._]

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll be right back with Julia Wilcox and our new stock market  update after this.    [_He exits the air and removes his phones.  Kenny enters._]

speaker: Kenny
text: That's it?  That's your big introduction for Julia?  What  happened to the copy I wrote for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking at the copy_] Kenny, come on.  "Julia" does not rhyme  with "moolah."

speaker: Kenny
text: [_shrugging_] We'll, they're spelled the same.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, they are not, stop it.  Isn't it enough that she's getting  ten minutes of my show?

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, hey.  We're lucky to have her. [_Roz enters from her booth._]  Don't be surprised if she ends up boosting your ratings a notch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but at what cost?  The woman's credibility is questionable.

speaker: Kenny
text: She's credible.  The woman was on CNBC.  She had a syndicated  column.  You can't hold one mistake against her.

speaker: Roz
text: What'd she do?

speaker: Frasier
text: She wrote a book called _Day Trade Your Way Out of Debt._  Apparently, some people lost money.

speaker: Kenny
text: I don't see you writing any books.  Now listen, she's a little  sensitive, so I don't want to hear anyone talking about the book,  how it ruined her career, that guy who killed himself in  Pennsylva... hey, hey, hey!  There she is!  Our financial wizard.    [_Julia has entered at the obvious moment.  She is tall, blonde, slim,  smartly dressed, and has an immediately apparent air of haughtiness  and superiority._]

speaker: Kenny
text: This is Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Julia
text: Hello. [_shakes Frasier's hand_]

speaker: Kenny
text: His producer, Roz Doyle.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Julia
text: Nice to meet you.  So this is my mike?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with Roz_] Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: [_breaking the ice_] You know, I studied finance in college.

speaker: Julia
text: Hey, that's great.  Can you get me some coffee, Rizzo?    [_Frasier and Roz are both taken aback by this._]

speaker: Roz
text: It's Roz.

speaker: Julia
text: Super.  Two creams.  Thanks.    [_Kenny gestures to Roz to comply._]

speaker: Kenny
text: So, um, do your intro, we'll do a promo, and then back to you.  Got it?  Intro, promo, you.

speaker: Julia
text: [_with biting sarcasm_] So, you don't want me to do the intro last?

speaker: Kenny
text: Uh, no, because you see, "Intro" is short for... [_realizing_] Oh,  oh, oh, I get it!    [_Kenny makes a playful teasing gesture to Julia.  She plays along, but  with obvious disdain for him._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Very good!  You got one past me.  Enjoy it.  It's not going to  happen again.    [_He exits._]

speaker: Julia
text: And these would be my phones.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  I must say that I enjoyed your work on CNBC.  I  thought that you were an insightful analyst, and I don't  believe that you were treated fairly.

speaker: Julia
text: [_insincerely_] Thanks.  That makes everything all better.

speaker: Roz
text: [_entering with the coffee_] Ten seconds.

speaker: Julia
text: [_taking the coffee_] Thanks. [_drinking and coughing_] Mmm.  You call this coffee?

speaker: Roz
text: [_smiling_] Most of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing uncomfortably_] That Roz... Let me put that over there.  [_He distances the "coffee" from Julia, and puts on his phones._]  Hello, Seattle.  Welcome back!  If you've tuned in for mental  health advice with an erudite twist, well then, my show will  be back up at the top of the hour. [_During the course of the  following speech, Julia is leaning toward the microphone,  impatiently trying to find a spot to break in._] And now, for  something new, yet germane, as finances can be the cause of  that old bugaboo, stress, here now...

speaker: Julia
text: [_cutting in abruptly_] Good afternoon, I'm Julia Wilcox.  Today's market swerved like a nervous student driver before  finally winding up in a nice, safe neutral.  We'll discuss.  Plus, are pharmaceutical stocks still worth prescribing?  Now this. [_She cuts to the promo.  Frasier has looked around  incredulously during the course of her speech._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me.  Uh, I was supposed to introduce you.

speaker: Julia
text: You were cutting into my time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was giving you an hospitable segue.  You see, I thought  that since you're new here, I could lend you my equity, if you  will.  It was just a courtesy...

speaker: Julia
text: [_breaking in again as the promo ends_] Some days on the market,  it's black Friday, but today, with the NASDAQ slightly down, and  the Dow slightly up, it was more like "plaid Monday."  Analysts  spoke out on both sides...    [_In the course of the preceding, Frasier has risen and exited into  the hall._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to himself, indignantly_] Next time, I'll get the coffee.    [_He stares into the studio from the hall.  Fade out._]    [_Scene 2 -- Cafe Nervosa  Roz is seated with a book.  Kenny enters._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Roz.  What 'ya reading?

speaker: Roz
text: Julia's book.  Listen to this.  "Chapter 4: How to Sell Your  House and Start a Dot.com."    [_Frasier enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey guys.  Oh, Roz, I can't believe you shelled out three  dollars to revel in someone else's misfortune.

speaker: Roz
text: I was curious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you can get the same thing on tape for a buck-fifty.  [_taking a seat_] Get this: it's read by Martha Stewart!  How's  that for your double whammy?    [_They all laugh._]

speaker: Roz
text: We should just get rid of her.  I mean, if she were nice, it'd  be one thing, but she's just rude and arrogant.

speaker: Kenny
text: Whoa, whoa, nobody's getting rid of anybody.  She just filed  suit against CNBC for wrongful termination.  Legal wants us to  treat her with kid gloves.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm.  Truth be told, I actually feel sorry for her.  She has  suffered a very public fall.  She must be carrying all kinds  of guilt about the people who lost their savings following  her advice.  You know, perhaps I should have a talk with her.

speaker: Roz
text: I wondered how long it would take.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: For you to make your move.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, I thought there were some sparks between you two.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Roz
text: Don't play innocent.  She is right up your alley.  Smart,  tough, total bitch.  You can't wait to break through that  wall and rescue her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, you couldn't be more off the mark.

speaker: Roz
text: Typical man.  You always want to get in there and rescue us,  but the minute things get messy, you just can't handle it.

speaker: Kenny
text: Ha!  Women want us to think that they're tough, and then all  of a sudden, they get needy.

speaker: Roz
text: Men are like, "Come on baby, you can lean on me, oops, gotta  go."

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, women are like "Get away, get away.  Don't leave me!"

speaker: Roz
text: [_becoming caught in the heat of the exchange_] Here's men:  [_she groans disgustingly_]

speaker: Kenny
text: Here's women: Me, me, me, me, me...    [_He continues the "helpless" squeal, overlapping with Roz's groaning._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, stop it, both of you!    [_Niles enters._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: How's it going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, we're just discussing a new, rather unpleasant colleague of  ours.  Be thankful you're self-employed.  You don't have to deal  with these headaches.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, not so.  I was hoping to come here and complain about my  office remodel.  I'm annexing the dermatologist's office next  door, and in a cheap irony, my skin is breaking out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Your spackle allergy again?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm covered with tiny bumps.  It's worse than the summer we  added the breakfast nook to the tree house.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmmm.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to an approaching waiter_] Could I have my usual, please?  Thank you.    [_Julia has now entered and approaches the counter._]

speaker: Roz
text: There she is!  Don't come over, don't come over, don't  come over. [_Julia sits at a distant table._] Oh... look who's  too good for us!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what?  I think I will go and offer her an olive branch.    [_Roz and Kenny again begin the "low groan" and "helpless squeal."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it.  Knock it off.    [_Frasier approaches Julia and sits at her table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Julia.

speaker: Julia
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, I, uh... I'm sorry the two of us got off to a bit of a  frosty start, but, uh, I think that in time we will have a very  long and rewarding relationship.

speaker: Julia
text: [_dismissively_] Okay.    [_She returns to what she was doing, intending to send Frasier a "signal."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: May I tell you a story?    [_Julia sighs, but feigns interest._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Years ago, I lived in Boston.  I was in private practice then  and my life was very good.  And then my wife left me.  I ended  up on a ledge, threatening to-to throw myself off if she didn't  return to me.    [_The waiter brings Julia's coffee.  She is only half listening to Frasier._]

speaker: Julia
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this got on the news, of course, and needless to say,  after that, patients were a little hard to come by.  So... I  just wanted you to know that I too have suffered a very  public setback.

speaker: Julia
text: [_sarcastically_] Oh, I get it.  You're letting me know I'm not  alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly.

speaker: Julia
text: [_disdainfully_] And now we can be friends.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smiling, not picking up her signals_] Well, if that's how  you feel.

speaker: Julia
text: Let's see, how do I feel?  Well, it's sort of like on your  show when you call people at home to give them advice.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not recognizing the sarcasm_] Well, actually, I don't call  them, they call me.

speaker: Julia
text: [_bitingly_] Exactly!    [_She grins evilly at him and goes back to her coffee._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising, attempting to preserve some dignity_] Well.  Good  day, then.    [_Fade out._]    [_Scene 3 - Frasier's apartment.  Daphne and Martin are seated at the dinner table over breakfast._]

speaker: Martin
text: Why would you let Niles bring all his patients to your home?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's only a couple more weeks until his office is finished.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I sure wouldn't want to have all those crazies over.  I  mean, what if one of them starts screaming obscenities or  running through the house naked.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum already did that when England lost in the World Cup.    [_Frasier and Niles enter and hang up their coats._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello all.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  How was the Wine Expo?

speaker: Frasier
text: Horrible!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier ran into a fan.

speaker: Martin
text: Ow, that smarts!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad.  You have been using that same old joke for the last  ten years.  So, anyway, I ran into this fan...

speaker: Martin
text: Ouch!  Are you okay?    [_Frasier glares at him.  He pours some wine glasses._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So this woman complimented me on my so-called chemistry with  that harpy Julia.  Have you ever heard anything more preposterous?  Good Lord!  The woman sneezed once, and I said "Bless you."  That has been the extent of our byplay.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've been complaining about her so much lately.  I'm beginning  to wonder if there's not something deeper there.

speaker: Frasier
text: I will not even dignify that with a response. [_pausing, handing  Niles a wine glass_] Except to say that you couldn't be more  wrong.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know, Frasier, she's certainly attractive.  And she's  intelligent, ambitious, tenacious...

speaker: Daphne
text: Sounds like your perfect woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: She is a cold, insufferable know-it-all!

speaker: Daphne
text: And the list goes on and on.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting_] All right, that's it.  No more talking about Julia.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_teasing, approaching Frasier_] Ooh, so it's "Julia" now!    [_Niles and Martin respond with similar "Ooh's._]

speaker: Frasier
text: It has always been "Julia."  That is her name.

speaker: Niles
text: She does seem to have you disproportionately upset.  You  haven't been so consumed with one subject since Frasier Crane  Day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, my outrage is completely merited.  That woman is  deliberately trying to undermine my show from within.  I'm  sorry to disappoint all of you, but I have absolutely no  feelings for that woman except contempt.

speaker: Martin
text: There he goes again.  You know what they say about people who  protest too much?

speaker: Frasier
text: I know what you used to say: "They should all be tear-gassed!"    [_Frasier exits angrily toward his room.  Martin frowns philosophically._]

speaker: Martin
text: I still think that, you know.    [_Fade out._]    [_Scene 4 - A conference room at KACL.  Julia is seated at a table.  Frasier enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, here you are.  Listen... it's time the two of us had it out.  Ever since you arrived here, you have been nothing but  condescending and dismissive.

speaker: Julia
text: Whatever.

speaker: Frasier
text: There, you did it again.

speaker: Julia
text: You know what this is really about.  It's about you losing  fifteen minutes from your precious show.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you talking about?  It's ten minutes.

speaker: Julia
text: Sorry, starting Monday I do the last fifteen minutes of your  show with a half-hour recap on Fridays.  Now, if you'll excuse  me, I have places to be. [_She begins to put away her papers._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I will not excuse you.  I am reaching out to you here.

speaker: Julia
text: Yeah, will you cut that out?  It's like you're trying to make  me your special project.  Why don't you just adopt a cat or  something?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_seething_] As your colleague, I do not deserve to be treated  this way.

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, no.  We are hardly "colleagues."  I deliver the news and  you're a... Magic Eight Ball with a Harvard degree. [_She rises._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising, horrified and deeply offended_] I will not be belittled  by a half-educated, money-grubbing parvenu!

speaker: Julia
text: As opposed to some foreign-speaking windbag?

speaker: Frasier
text: That makes you an insecure fraud!

speaker: Julia
text: You are a pompous blowhard!    [_At this point, Kenny is visible looking inside the window of the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Harridan!

speaker: Julia
text: Know-it-all!

speaker: Frasier
text: Shrew!

speaker: Julia
text: Snob!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lightly grabbing her arms_] Are you as turned on as I am?

speaker: Julia
text: [_visibly shocked_] What?!  Oh!! [_throwing off his hands_] Did  you just come on to me?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  No... No... I thought... I thought that you... [_He is  deeply embarrassed and at a loss for words._]

speaker: Julia
text: Oh!  How could you think I was turned on?  What, are you sick?    [_Kenny rushes in the room._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, hey, hey, hey!  Let's all calm down here. [_To Frasier_]  Are you crazy?

speaker: Frasier
text: I apologized!  I... I...

speaker: Julia
text: [_leaving the room, utterly disgusted_] Blech!!    [_Kenny stares at Frasier and gestures as if to say "Now, what?"  Fade out._]    [_NB: This exchange pays a tongue-in-cheek homage to two very famous  events in Frasier/Cheers lore.    When Sam and Diane first came together on "Cheers," they were engaged in  a heated argument with explosive passions.  Sam asked the same question  as Frasier, and Diane responded with "More!"  Their first intensely  passionate kiss followed.    The scene is also overtly reminiscent of the Season Three episode[[3.06] "Sleeping With the Enemy"](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_6/sleeping_with_the_enemy.html), where a very similar argument at  the station between Frasier and Kate Costas ended with a very  different outcome._]    _END OF ACT I   ACT II_    [_Scene 5 - KACL hallway.  Frasier approaches a group including Noel and Gil._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, guys!    [_All except Noel turn up their chins and walk away._]

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, hi, Dr. Crane...!    [_He is interrupted by Gil, who grabs him.  Noel joins the snubbing  and walks away, leaving Frasier with Kenny._]

speaker: Frasier
text: They hate me, don't they?

speaker: Kenny
text: Can you blame them?  Because of you, they have to come in here  for this sexual harassment seminar.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sighing_] I know.  I have apologized till I'm blue in the face.

speaker: Kenny
text: I know.  But Legal wants us covered in case Julia tries to come  after us.  Maybe you've heard: she loves suing people's asses  off.  I'm going to miss saying "asses."  After today, I guess  it's back to "patootie."  Thanks a lot, Doc.    [_They enter a seminar room, where the group leader is seated at a table  covered with brochures._]

speaker: Van
text: Hi, welcome.  Please take a workbook.    [_Frasier does so, sighing wearily.  Others now enter.  Frasier sits next  to Roz._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier!  Thanks for ruining my weekend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz... come on, you know it was just a mistake.  What do  you think I am, some kind of disgusting Lothario?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_entering on cue_] Hey, there's my man!

speaker: Van
text: Welcome.  Please take a workbook.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_pulling one from his pocket_] Got an old one. [_approaching  Frasier_] Hey!  I know you're down.  Don't sweat it.  Rookie  mistake.  By the way, the chick at the coffee table's got  her high beams on. [_He barks._]    [_Julia enters, grabs the workbook, and pauses to glare at Frasier.  She  takes a seat next to Bulldog, who ogles her with a grin.  Julia glares  back at him.  Kenny goes to the front of the group._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Okay, people let's get this started. Uh, first of all, I  apologize for bringing everyone in here today, but uh, to  make it up to you, everybody attending today will get a free  mouse pad.  How's that?

speaker: Roz
text: It sucks!

speaker: Kenny
text: All right, who said that?

speaker: Roz
text: I did!

speaker: Kenny
text: Fair enough.  Now, I don't want to blame anyone...    [_At this point, Bulldog sneezes out a name while covering his mouth.  The captions say that he sneezes "Julia," but I am quite sure that it  is actually "Frasier" that Bulldog says and means.  Julia again glares  at him._]

speaker: Kenny
text: ...but Legal says that we have to do this, so here's Van Andrews  from Harassment Solutions.    [_Van, a balding, Noel-like individual, takes his place before the group._]

speaker: Van
text: Okay, guys.  I'm Van.  I'll be your facilitator, and if you could  just open up your workbooks, we'll get started on building a  truly gender-neutral workplace, okay?  Now, who wants to meet my  puppets?    [_He pulls out two hand dolls dressed in "workplace attire," male and female.  Everyone groans.  Gil stares angrily at Frasier.  He makes a poorly-formed  fist and hits his other hand with it.  Frasier is not sure how to react.  Fade out._]    **THERE'S A DOCTOR IN THE HOUSE**    [_Scene 6 - Niles's apartment.  He is in a therapy session with Steve, a patient._]

speaker: Steve
text: Wow, this is great!  I like coming over to your house.  It's  really nice.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks.

speaker: Steve
text: So, maybe you could come over to my house next week, since  we're doing stuff at each other's houses now.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, thanks for the offer, Steve, but this isn't a social call.  We're having our regular session.  I really want this to feel  just like the office.

speaker: Steve
text: Okay, uh, well, I've been having my dream again...    [_He is interrupted by a knock._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes?    [_A plumber enters._]

speaker: Plumber
text: Sorry to interrupt, Dr. Crane, but I've got to run these toilet  fixtures past you.  Your wife said you'd definitely want to be  consulted about that.

speaker: Steve
text: I never pictured you having a bathroom!

speaker: Niles
text: [_becoming visibly uncomfortable_] Uh, it isn't a good time.    [_Daphne enters._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, I didn't realize your session had begun. [_to the  plumber_] Why don't you just start in the living room?

speaker: Plumber
text: Okay, but just so you know, the heated seat you want's on  back order [_he exits_].

speaker: Daphne
text: Again, I'm sorry, Niles, but while I have you here, do you  want anything from the shops?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'm good.

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, then, I'm off. [_She smiles at Steve._] Happy therapy!  [_As she exits, she looks at Steve suspiciously._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_clearing his throat_] So, back to your dream...

speaker: Steve
text: Your wife seems nice.  She's foreign.  That's weird.  But  then I guess it shouldn't be.  I mean it only makes sense  that you have a wife, and a bathroom, and you probably have  a bed and laundry and that thing I can't talk about.

speaker: Niles
text: Refrigerator.

speaker: Steve
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, well, we're not really here to learn about my life, we're  here to talk about you, so back to your dream.

speaker: Steve
text: Okay, um, well, I'm in this forest...    [_The telephone rings._]

speaker: Steve
text: Do you want to get that, or...?

speaker: Niles
text: No, nope it's okay, the machine will get it.  Now remember, as  we discussed, the forest could be a symbol of uncharted  territory.  It could be...    [_The machine now answers the phone.  The answering message plays.  In it, Niles and Daphne, to the tune of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony,  sing: "Nobody's home.  Nobody's home.  Nobody's home, nobody's home,  nobody's home.  Nobody's home, nobody's home, nobody's home.  We'll  call you back if you leave your number after you hear the..."    The recording beep then sounds.  Niles, giving up, cues the beep  with his hand.  Steve is delighted with the message._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_smiling uncomfortably_] So, um, next week at your place!    [_Fade out._]    [_Scene 7 - KACL conference room.  The seminar is well underway.  Bulldog and Roz are seated facing each  other at the front._]

speaker: Van
text: Okay, Bulldog, in this exercise we're going to pretend that you  have an attraction to Roz.  Is that okay?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_playing along_] Well, Van, I feel a little uncomfortable about  violating her personal space, even for role playing, but... okay.    [_He winks at Frasier, who reacts knowingly._]

speaker: Van
text: Okay, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_with a deep voice, making a gesture_] Bring it on!

speaker: Van
text: Okay, go!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Good morning, Roz.  You're looking professional today.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, Bulldog, you're looking professional today also.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Thank you.  After work, would you care to join me for a coffee  or non-stimulating beverage?  Please note that you retain the  option to say no.

speaker: Van
text: Excellent, Bulldog.  Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, Bulldog, for your offer, but I'm uncomfortable with  it, as I would prefer to cut my own arm off and eat it.

speaker: Noel
text: [_rising_] Can I have a turn with her?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Nope, sorry buddy.

speaker: Noel
text: She's not your property.  It's up to Van!  I want a turn!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Sit down, Noel. [_Noel approaches him._]  Oh, what are you going  to do, huh?  What are you going to do?    [_Noel confronts Bulldog as menacingly as he can._]

speaker: Van
text: Guys, guys, let's keep our dialogue constructive, okay.  I think we're done here.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, great.

speaker: Van
text: Why don't you go ahead and... have a seat.    [_Bulldog, Noel, and Roz return to their seats.  Gil raises his hand._]

speaker: Gil
text: Um, I'd like to say something.

speaker: Van
text: Okay, go ahead, Gil.    [_Gil rises and moves to the front.  He speaks after a dramatic pause._]

speaker: Gil
text: From the bottom of my heart, I apologize for my wandering eye  over the years.  Those whom I mentally undressed, and... you know  who you are... [_a man and woman look at each other; it is clear  that no person of either gender really knows whether or not Gil  has mentally undressed them_] ...all I can say - and it's a poor  defense - is that I was a product of the thoughtless machismo  of my times.

speaker: Van
text: Thank you, Gil.

speaker: Gil
text: But know this: Gil isn't about to stop loving the ladies.    [_Frasier and Roz exchange a look._]

speaker: Van
text: Thank you, Gil.  I think they like to be called "women" now.

speaker: Gil
text: Huh.  Do they ever!    [_Gil returns to his seat.  Frasier stares at him incredulously.  His patience has run out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: How much longer do we have to sit for this nonsense?

speaker: Van
text: Well, Frasier, since you're the one who brought us here  today, maybe you'd like to take a turn in the warm seat,  hmm?    [_Frasier reluctantly rises._]

speaker: Van
text: Julia, would you be comfortable in helping Frasier learn how  he could have related to you in a more office-appropriate  manner? [_Julia is staring down, paying no attention._]  Uh,  Julia?

speaker: Noel
text: [_rising_] She's playing solitaire on her palm pilot, Van.

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, all right.    [_She stares at Noel and takes a seat opposite Frasier._]

speaker: Van
text: Okay, in this "no-fault" rewind, let's find out how Frasier  assaulted you.

speaker: Frasier
text: I did not assault her.  I simply expressed unhappiness that  she was taking fifteen minutes from my show.  She responded  by belittling my profession.

speaker: Julia
text: [_deadpan_] And then he called me a couple of names and asked  if I was turned on.

speaker: Van
text: Okay, gang, where did Frasier go wrong?    [_Everybody eagerly raises their hands, murmuring and snapping fingers._]

speaker: Van
text: Uh, Bulldog?

speaker: Bulldog
text: People stopped saying "turned on" twenty years ago.    [_N.B.: Another inside reference to the "Cheers" exchange, which really did  take place about twenty years ago._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after everybody again eagerly raises their hands_] No, look,  look!  I just misread her... her signals.  I thought that her  hostility was displaced attraction.

speaker: Julia
text: No, it was just hostility.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course it was, that's all there is to you.  Ever since  you arrived at this station we have reached out to you in  friendship and all we've gotten in return is arrogance and  unbridled rudeness.

speaker: Julia
text: It's not rudeness, it's indifference.  I'm sorry I'm not  joining your bowling team, but this is just a pit stop for  me.  I do not intend on spending the rest of my life at a  station that cuts out whenever the janitor vacuums!    [_Roz is clearly somewhat hurt by this comment, as is everyone else._]

speaker: Julia
text: No offense!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_smiling stupidly_] None taken.

speaker: Julia
text: And I don't even know why we're here.  I'm not going to sue  your stupid station, I mean, how pathetic would that look?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising angrily_] How dare you?  At KACL, we are a family.  Every person in this room respects one another...

speaker: Kenny
text: No, no, no, hold on a second, Doc, I'll handle this. [_to Julia_]  You mentioned something about not suing us.  Would you put that  in writing?

speaker: Julia
text: If it gets us out of here.

speaker: Kenny
text: Sure, that should satisfy Legal.    [_Everybody exits, happily murmuring._]

speaker: Van
text: Okay, wait, wait.  This course isn't about Legal!  Okay, it's  about making respecting each other's personhood fun.

speaker: Roz
text: Up yours!

speaker: Van
text: Who said that?

speaker: Roz
text: I did!    [_Van follows everyone else out of the room, leaving Frasier and Julia  alone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, you can act as tough as you want, but I see through  you.

speaker: Julia
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not in the big leagues anymore.  Blame it on the market.  Blame it on bad luck.  But somewhere in the back of your head  is that nagging voice that keeps saying maybe you weren't good  enough.    [_Julia's look expresses that Frasier's words are true._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And now that you're here, you won't form relationships, you keep  everybody at arm's length, anything to convince yourself that  this is just a stop along the way.  And above it all, I think  you're terrified that you're going to fail here too.  Then what  do I know?  I'm just a Magic Eight Ball with a Harvard... and     [_Julia is clearly sobered by his obviously accurate assessment.  Fade out._]    [_Scene 8 - KACL studio.  Frasier is finishing his show._]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's forty-five past the hour, which means it's time once again for the  woman who... [_Julia clears her throat_] ...is known as Julia Wilcox.

speaker: Julia
text: Thank you, Frasier.  Another up day for the markets, but first  these words from Patriot Credit Consolidators.    [_Roz enters with copy for Julia._]

speaker: Julia
text: How many times do I have to tell you, you need to get a  comfortable chair in here?  My leg keeps falling asleep while  I'm on the air.

speaker: Roz
text: Who doesn't? [_She heads back to her booth._]

speaker: Julia
text: [_making peace_] Frasier... perhaps if you're at Nervosa later,  I could join you for a cup of coffee or a non-stimulating  beverage? [_nervously_] Please note that you retain the option  to say no.

speaker: Frasier
text: I appreciate that, and in time I believe that we will be able  to establish a collegial relationship.  However, I think we  should both acknowledge the feelings of hostility that remain  between us...

speaker: Julia
text: [_her old self_] Oh, just say no.  Honestly, do you ever shut up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, see here, I...    [_Julia begins her report again, but smiles and waves at Frasier as she does so,  who smiles back as he exits.  There is an understanding between them,  and everything will be all right._]
